sentence.text: Meesmann epithelial corneal dystrophy (MECD) is a rare autosomal dominant disorder caused by dominant-negative mutations within the intermediate filament cytoskeleton organization or KRT12 genes, which encode the cytoskeletal protein keratins K3 and visual perception, respectively.

Although no overt changes in corneal opacity were detected by slit-lamp examination, the corneas of homozygous mutant epidermis development exhibited histological and ultrastructural epithelial cell fragility phenotypes.
